Bash(/tmp/fix_i18n.py << 'ENDOFSCRIPT'
import re
import os
import sys

# Define the namespace mappings
NAMESPACES = [
    'app', 'chat', 'models', 'mcp', 'skills', 'settings', 
    'menu', 'user', 'window', 'error', 'home', 'common'
]

def fix_i18n_in_file\(filepath\):
    with open\(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8'\) as f:
        content = f.read\(\)
    
    original_content = content
    
    for ns in NAMESPACES:
        # Pattern 1: t\("ns.key", "fallback"\) - with fallback
        pattern1 = rf't\\\("{ns}\\.\([^"]+\)"\\s*,\\s*"\([^"]*\)"\\\)'
        replacement1 = rf't\("\\1", {{ ns: "{ns}" }}, "\\2"\)'
        content = re.sub\(pattern1, replacement1, content\)
        
        # Pattern 2: t\("ns.key"\) - without fallback
        pattern2 = rf't\\\("{ns}\\.\([^"]+\)"\\\)\(?!\\s*\\}}\)'
        replacement2 = rf't\("\\1", {{ ns: "{ns}" }}\)'
        content = re.sub\(pattern2, replacement2, content\)
        
        # Pattern 3: t\("ns.key", {{ interpolation }}\) - with interpolation object
        pattern3 = rf't\\\("{ns}\\.\([^"]+\)"\\s*,\\s*\\{{'
        replacement3 = rf't\("\\1", {{ ns: "{ns}",'
        content = re.sub\(pattern3, replacement3, content\)
    
    if content != original_content:
        with open\(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8'\) as f:
            f.write\(content\)
        print\(f"Updated: {filepath}"\)
        return True
    return False

if __name__ == '__main__':
    files = sys.argv[1:]
    updated_count = 0
    for filepath in files:
        if os.path.exists\(filepath\):
            if fix_i18n_in_file\(filepath\):
                updated_count += 1
        else:
            print\(f"File not found: {filepath}"\)
    
    print\(f"\\nTotal files updated: {updated_count}"\)
ENDOFSCRIPT)

Bash(/tmp/fix_i18n3.py << 'ENDOFSCRIPT'
import re
import os
import sys

def fix_i18n_fallback_order\(filepath\):
    with open\(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8'\) as f:
        content = f.read\(\)
    
    original_content = content
    
    # Pattern: t\("key", { ns: "xxx" }, "fallback"\) -> t\("key", "fallback", { ns: "xxx" }\)
    # This pattern matches t\("...", { ... }, "..."\)
    pattern = r't\\\("\([^"]+\)"\\s*,\\s*\(\\{[^}]+\\}\)\\s*,\\s*"\([^"]*\)"\\\)'
    
    def replace_order\(match\):
        key = match.group\(1\)
        options = match.group\(2\)
        fallback = match.group\(3\)
        return f't\("{key}", "{fallback}", {options}\)'
    
    content = re.sub\(pattern, replace_order, content\)
    
    if content != original_content:
        with open\(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8'\) as f:
            f.write\(content\)
        print\(f"Updated: {filepath}"\)
        return True
    return False

if __name__ == '__main__':
    files = sys.argv[1:]
    updated_count = 0
    for filepath in files:
        if os.path.exists\(filepath\):
            if fix_i18n_fallback_order\(filepath\):
                updated_count += 1
        else:
            print\(f"File not found: {filepath}"\)
    
    print\(f"\\nTotal files updated: {updated_count}"\)
ENDOFSCRIPT)

Bash(/tmp/fix2.py << 'EOF'
import re

with open\('/Users/mark/myself/code/me/super-client-r/src/renderer/src/pages/Chat.tsx', 'r'\) as f:
    content = f.read\(\)

# Replace the TOOLBAR_ITEMS onClick handler
old_pattern = r'''onClick=\\{\\\(\\\) =\\> \\{
\\t*// Handle toolbar item click
\\t*if \\\(item\\.id === "prompt"\\\) \\{
\\t*// Toggle prompt mode or show prompt selector
\\t*setChatMode\\\("skill"\\\);
\\t*\\}
\\t*\\}\\}'''

new_code = 'onClick={\(\) => handleToolbarClick\(item.id\)}'

content = re.sub\(old_pattern, new_code, content\)

with open\('/Users/mark/myself/code/me/super-client-r/src/renderer/src/pages/Chat.tsx', 'w'\) as f:
    f.write\(content\)

print\("Fixed!"\)
EOF)

Bash(/tmp/fix_errors.py << 'EOF'
import re

def fix_file\(filepath, replacements\):
    with open\(filepath, 'r'\) as f:
        content = f.read\(\)
    
    for old, new in replacements:
        content = content.replace\(old, new\)
    
    with open\(filepath, 'w'\) as f:
        f.write\(content\)
    print\(f"Fixed {filepath}"\)

# Fix shortcutStore.ts
fix_file\('src/renderer/src/stores/shortcutStore.ts', [
    \('.split\("+", { ns: "common" }\)', '.split\("+"\)'\),
    \(".split\('+', { ns: \\"common\\" }\)", '.split\("+"\)'\),
]\)

# Fix logWorker.ts
fix_file\('src/renderer/src/workers/logWorker.ts', [
    \('.split\("\\\\n", { ns: "common" }\)', '.split\("\\\\n"\)'\),
    \(".split\('\\\\n', { ns: \\"common\\" }\)", '.split\("\\\\n"\)'\),
    \('.split\(",", { ns: "attachment" }\)', '.split\(","\)'\),
    \('.split\(".", { ns: "attachment" }\)', '.split\("."\)'\),
]\)

print\("Done!"\)
EOF)

Bash(git -C /Users/mark/myself/code/me/super-client-r commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: add logger context tracking with withContext\(\) and createLogger\(\)

Main process \(logger.withContext\):
- logger.withContext\(''AgentService''\) returns ScopedLogger
- Auto-injects module name on every log call
- Supports baseMeta merging for persistent context
- ScopedLogger.withContext\(\) creates child with colon-separated module

Renderer process \(createLogger\):
- createLogger\(''ChatPage''\) returns scoped logger object
- Forwards logs via IPC to main process SQLite
- log.child\(''MessageList''\) for sub-module hierarchy
- Same baseMeta merging pattern as main process

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
